ai.summary: An easy 4.2 km coastal walk along the Strangford Lough shoreline. The route offers sea views, simple paths, and opportunities to spot birds and marine life, making it suitable for families and beginners.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly gravel and compact dirt paths with gentle gradients; some grassy sections and a few boardwalks over marshy areas; footing can be uneven or muddy after rain; expect exposed coastal winds.
ai.safety_notes: - Check tide times if the route runs close to the water; stay on marked paths. - Weather can change quickly; bring layers and rain protection. - Wear sturdy footwear with good grip; watch for slick or wet stones. - Carry water, sun protection in summer, and a small first aid kit. - Let someone know your plan and estimated return time; mobile signal may be limited in rural stretches.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or lightweight hiking boots
Map, compass or offline navigation app
Phone with emergency contacts and a small first aid kit
Optional: tide times or local trail notes
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to September) offer milder weather and better daylight for coastal wildlife viewing; winter visits are valid but can be cold, windy, and wet.

seo.title: Kearney Coastal Walk, Strangford Lough – Easy 4.2 km Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the easy 4.2 km Kearney coastal walk along Strangford Lough. Coastal scenery, wildlife, and accessible terrain suitable for families and beginners in the UK.
